title.narrative: Challenges of word trade - business and human rights

description.narrative: The project deepens citizens? and companies? understanding on corporate sustainability structures of world trade and their linkages to developing countries and livelihoods of their citizens. It expands and deepens the dialogue between Finnish companies civ il society and consumers on corporate sustainability evaluates sustainability work of companies and increases the awareness of youth and teachers on corporate responsibility and world trade. The main outcomes of the project are 3 reports innovative communi cations materials and training for youth social media influencers teachers and companies. In addition teaching material will be developed. 100 youth will be trained to assess corporate sustainability. By evaluating the sustainability performance of 20 cons umer brands the project will raise awareness on sustainability and inequality of world trade: from production of raw materials to global division of labour. As a result of the project companies will strenghten their sustainability work and communicate on i t more openly. Dialogue with 35 textile companies will be deepened by concentrating on more challenging human rights issues in their value chain such as living wages. A study and a training for companies are key activities. They are supported by a collabor ation with partner companies in India and Bangladesh.Innovative communications work has a central role in raising awareness of young people. The impact of the structures of international trade on the developing countries will be dealt with in a series of s ocial media videos. The novel concept uses youthful humorous videos to explain complex issues based on new research. The video series will reach at least 200 000 viewers.An online learning material will be developed as well as individual exercises for pupi ls to accompany each video. The materials will be disseminated to teachers and teacher students through training and peer groups (3000). The project also offers youth opportunities for social media activism and a training component for social media influen cers who are important drivers of youth?s values and attitudes today. In total the project will reach 500 000 people.
